properties.name: astra.api.applicationToken
properties.description: Also called Api Key, it acts as your credentials to use Astra Apis.

properties.name: astra.api.databaseId
properties.description: Unique identifier of an Astra database, part of urls to access Stargate Api.

properties.name: astra.api.databaseRegion
properties.description: Main region name of an Astra database to connect (also Datacenter name)

properties.name: astra.api.grpc.enabled
properties.description: If set to true a connection will be established to Astra using gRPC stubs

properties.name: astra.cql.enabled
properties.description: If set to true a connection will be established to Astra using CqlSession

properties.name: astra.cql.downloadScb.enabled
properties.description: If set to true the secure connect bundle zip files will be downloaded using Devops API.

properties.name: astra.cql.downloadScb.path
properties.description: Folder to download and read SCB if not cloud zip file provided in configuration.

properties.name: astra.cql.downloadScb.pattern
properties.description: File name pattern to create or read SCB.

properties.name: astra.cql.metrics
properties.description: If enabled and the actuactor is in the classpath the metrics will be available

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.basic.contact-points
properties.description: The contact points to use for the initial connection to the cluster.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.basic.session-name
properties.description: A name that uniquely identifies the driver instance created from this configuration. This is used as a prefix for log messages and metrics.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.basic.session-keyspace
properties.description: The name of the keyspace that the session should initially be connected to.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.basic.config-reload-interval
properties.description: How often the driver tries to reload the configuration, How often the driver tries to reload the configuration.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.basic.request.timeout
properties.description: How long the driver waits for a request to complete. This is a global limit on the duration of a session.execute() call, including any internal retries the driver might do.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.basic.request.page-size
properties.description: The page size. This controls how many rows will be retrieved simultaneously in a single network roundtrip.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.basic.request.serial-consistency
properties.description: The serial consistency level. The allowed values are SERIAL and LOCAL_SERIAL.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.basic.request.consistency
properties.description: How long the driver waits for a request to complete. This is a global limit on the duration of a session.execute() call

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.basic.load-balancing-policy.class
properties.description: The class of the policy. If it is not qualified, the driver assumes that it resides in the package com.datastax.oss.driver.internal.core.loadbalancing.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.basic.load-balancing-policy.filter.class
properties.description: The datacenter that is considered local: the default policy will only include nodes from

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.basic.load-balancing-policy.local-datacenter
properties.description: A custom filter to include/exclude nodes.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.connection.init-query-timeout
properties.description: The timeout to use for internal queries that run as part of the initialization process, just after we open a connection

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.connection.set-keyspace-timeout
properties.description: The timeout to use when the driver changes the keyspace on a connection at runtime (this happens when the client issues a `USE ...` query, and all connections belonging to the current session need to be updated).

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.connection.pool.local.size
properties.description: The number of connections in the pool.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.connection.pool.remote.size
properties.description: The number of connections in the pool.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.connection.max-requests-per-connection
properties.description: The maximum number of requests that can be executed concurrently on a connection. This must be between 1 and 32768.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.connection.max-orphan-requests
properties.description: The maximum number of - orphaned - requests before a connection gets closed automatically.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.connection.warn-on-init-error
properties.description: Whether to log non-fatal errors when the driver tries to open a new connection.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.reconnect-on-init
properties.description: Whether to schedule reconnection attempts if all contact points are unreachable on the first initialization attempt.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.reconnection-policy.class
properties.description: The policy that controls how often the driver tries to re-establish connections to down nodes.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.retry-policy.class
properties.description: The policy that controls if the driver retries requests that have failed on one node.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.speculative-execution-policy.class
properties.description: The class of the policy. If it is not qualified, the driver assumes that it resides in the package com.datastax.oss.driver.internal.core.specex.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.speculative-execution-policy.max-executions
properties.description: The maximum number of executions (including the initial, non-speculative execution). This must be at least one.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.speculative-execution-policy.delay
properties.description: The delay between each execution. 0 is allowed, and will result in all executions being sent simultaneously when the request starts.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.auth-provider.class
properties.description: The class of the provider. If it is not qualified, the driver assumes that it resides in the package com.datastax.oss.driver.internal.core.auth.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.ssl-engine-factory.class
properties.description: The class of the factory. If it is not qualified, the driver assumes that it resides in the package com.datastax.oss.driver.internal.core.ssl.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.ssl-engine-factory.cipher-suites
properties.description: The cipher suites to enable when creating an SSLEngine for a connection.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.ssl-engine-factory.hostname-validation
properties.description: Whether or not to require validation that the hostname of the server certificate's common name matches the hostname of the server being connected to. If not set, defaults to true.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.ssl-engine-factory.truststore-path
properties.description: The locations and passwords used to access truststore and keystore contents.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.ssl-engine-factory.truststore-password
properties.description: The locations and passwords used to access truststore and keystore contents.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.ssl-engine-factory.keystore-path
properties.description: The locations and passwords used to access truststore and keystore contents.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.ssl-engine-factory.keystore-password
properties.description: The locations and passwords used to access truststore and keystore contents.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.timestamp-generator.class
properties.description: The generator that assigns a microsecond timestamp to each request.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.timestamp-generator.drift-warning.threshold
properties.description: How far in the future timestamps are allowed to drift before the warning is logged. If it is undefined or set to 0, warnings are disabled.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.timestamp-generator.drift-warning.interval
properties.description: How often the warning will be logged if timestamps keep drifting above the threshold.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.timestamp-generator.force-java-clock
properties.description: Whether to force the driver to use Java's millisecond-precision system clock.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.request-tracker.class
properties.description: The class of the tracker. If it is not qualified, the driver assumes that it resides in the package com.datastax.oss.driver.internal.core.tracker.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.request-tracker.logs.slow.threshold
properties.description: The threshold to classify a successful request as slow. If this is unset, all successful requests will be considered as normal.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.request-tracker.logs.slow.enabled
properties.description: Whether to log slow requests.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.request-tracker.logs.error.enabled
properties.description: Whether to log failed requests.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.request-tracker.logs.max-query-length
properties.description: The maximum length of the query string in the log message. If it is longer than that, it will be truncated.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.request-tracker.logs.show-values
properties.description: Whether to log bound values in addition to the query string.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.request-tracker.logs.max-value-length
properties.description: The maximum length for bound values in the log message. If the formatted representation of a value is longer than that, it will be truncated.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.request-tracker.logs.max-values
properties.description: The maximum number of bound values to log. If a request has more values, the list of values will be truncated.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.request-tracker.logs.show-stack-traces
properties.description: Whether to log stack traces for failed queries. If this is disabled, the log will just include the exception's string representation (generally the class name and message).

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.throttler.class
properties.description: The class of the throttler. If it is not qualified, the driver assumes that it resides in  the package com.datastax.oss.driver.internal.core.session.throttling.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.throttler.max-concurrent-requests
properties.description: The maximum number of requests that are allowed to execute in parallel.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.throttler.max-requests-per-second
properties.description: The maximum allowed request rate. Only used by RateLimitingRequestThrottler.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.throttler.drain-interval
properties.description: How often the throttler attempts to dequeue requests.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.schema-change-listener.clas
properties.description: A session-wide component that listens for node state changes.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.node-state-listener.class
properties.description: A session-wide component that listens for node state changes.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.address-translator.class
properties.description: The address translator to use to convert the addresses sent by Cassandra nodes into ones that the driver uses to connect.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.resolve-contact-points
properties.description: Whether to resolve the addresses passed to `basic.contact-points`.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.protocol.version
properties.description: The native protocol version to use.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.protocol.compression
properties.description: The name of the algorithm used to compress protocol frames.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.protocol.max-frame-length
properties.description: The maximum length of the frames supported by the driver. Beyond that limit, requests will fail with an exception

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.request.warn-if-set-keyspace
properties.description: Whether a warning is logged when a request (such as a CQL `USE ...`) changes the active keyspace.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.request.trace.attempts
properties.description: How many times the driver will attempt to fetch the query if it is not ready yet.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.request.trace.interval
properties.description: The interval between each attempt.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.request.trace.consistency
properties.description: The consistency level to use for trace queries.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.request.log-warnings
properties.description: Whether logging of server warnings generated during query execution should be disabled by the driver.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metrics.session.enabled
properties.description: The session-level metrics (all disabled by default).
properties.defaultValue: [bytes-sent, bytes-received, connected-nodes, cql-requests, cql-client-timeouts, cql-prepared-cache-size, throttling.delay, throttling.queue-size, throttling.errors]

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metrics.session.cql-requests.highest-latency
properties.description: The largest latency that we expect to record.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metrics.session.cql-requests.significant-digits
properties.description: The number of significant decimal digits to which internal structures will maintain value resolution and separation

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metrics.session.cql-requests.refresh-interval
properties.description: The interval at which percentile data is refreshed.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metrics.node.enabled
properties.description: The node-level metrics (all disabled by default).
properties.defaultValue: [pool.open-connections, pool.available-streams, pool.in-flight, pool.orphaned-streams, bytes-sent, bytes-sent, cql-messages, errors.request.unsent, errors.request.aborted, errors.request.write-timeouts, errors.request.read-timeouts, errors.request.unavailables, errors.request.others, retries.total, retries.aborted, retries.read-timeout, retries.write-timeout, retries.unavailable, retries.other, ignores.total, ignores.aborted, ignores.read-timeout, ignores.write-timeout, ignores.unavailable, ignores.other, speculative-executions, errors.connection.init, errors.connection.auths]

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metrics.node.cql-messages.highest-latency
properties.description: See cql-requests in the -session- section.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metrics.node.cql-messages.significant-digits
properties.description: See cql-requests in the -session- section

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metrics.node.cql-messages.refresh-interval
properties.description: See cql-requests in the -session- section

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.socket.tcp-no-delay
properties.description: Whether or not to disable the Nagle algorithm.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.socket.keep-alive
properties.description: Whether or not to enable TCP keep-alive probes.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.socket.reuse-address
properties.description: Whether or not to allow address reuse.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.socket.linger-interval
properties.description: Sets the linger interval.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.socket.receive-buffer-size
properties.description: Sets a hint to the size of the underlying buffers for incoming network I/O.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.socket.send-buffer-size
properties.description: Sets a hint to the size of the underlying buffers for outgoing network I/O.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.heartbeat.interval
properties.description: The heartbeat interval.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.heartbeat.timeout
properties.description: The heartbeat interval.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metadata.topology-event-debouncer.window
properties.description: How long the driver waits to propagate an event

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metadata.topology-event-debouncer.max-events
properties.description: The maximum number of events that can accumulate.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metadata.schema.enabled
properties.description: Whether schema metadata is enabled.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metadata.schema.refreshed-keyspaces
properties.description: The list of keyspaces for which schema and token metadata should be maintained.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metadata.schema.request-timeout
properties.description: The timeout for the requests to the schema tables.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metadata.schema.request-page-size
properties.description: The page size for the requests to the schema tables.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metadata.schema.debouncer.window
properties.description: How long the driver waits to apply a refresh.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metadata.schema.debouncer.max-events
properties.description: The maximum number of refreshes that can accumulate.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.metadata.token-map.enabled
properties.description: Whether token metadata (Cluster.getMetadata.getTokenMap) is enabled.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.control-connection.timeout
properties.description: How long the driver waits for responses to control queries (e.g. fetching the list of nodes, refreshing the schema).

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.control-connection.schema-agreement.interval
properties.description: The interval between each attempt.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.control-connection.schema-agreement.timeout
properties.description: The timeout after which schema agreement fails.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.control-connection.schema-agreement.warn-on-failure
properties.description: Whether to log a warning if schema agreement fails.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.prepared-statements.prepare-on-all-nodes
properties.description: Whether Session.prepare calls should be sent to all nodes in the cluster.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.prepared-statements.reprepare-on-up.enabled
properties.description: Whether the driver tries to prepare on new nodes at all.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.prepared-statements.reprepare-on-up.check-system-table
properties.description: Whether to check `system.prepared_statements` on the target node before repreparing.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.prepared-statements.reprepare-on-up.max-statements
properties.description: The maximum number of statements that should be reprepared. 0 or a negative value means no limit.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.prepared-statements.reprepare-on-up.max-parallelism
properties.description: The maximum number of concurrent requests when repreparing.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.prepared-statements.reprepare-on-up.timeout
properties.description: The request timeout. This applies both to querying the system.prepared_statements table (if relevant), and the prepare requests themselves.)

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.netty.daemon
properties.description: Whether the threads created by the driver should be daemon threads.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.netty.io-group.size
properties.description: The number of threads.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.netty.admin-group.size
properties.description: The number of threads.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.netty.timer.tick-duration
properties.description: The timer tick duration.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.netty.timer.ticks-per-wheel
properties.description: Number of ticks in a Timer wheel.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.coalescer.max-runs-with-no-work
properties.description: How many times the coalescer is allowed to reschedule itself when it did no work.

properties.name: astra.cql.driver-config.advanced.coalescer.reschedule-interval
properties.description: The reschedule interval.

values.description: All
Quorum in each datacenter.
Quorum of all nodes across all datacenters. Some level of failure is possible.
Quorum of replicas in the same datacenter as the coordinator node. Avoids communication latency between datacenters.
Closest replica as determined by the snitch. Satisfies the needs of most users because the consistency requirements are not stringent.
Closest two replicas as determined by the snitch.
Closest three replicas as determined by the snitch.
Returns a response from the closest replica in the local datacenter. For security and quality, use in an offline datacenter to prevent automatic connection to online nodes in other datacenters.
Closest replica, as determined by the snitch. If all replica nodes are down, write succeeds after a hinted handoff. Provides low latency and guarantees that writes never fail.
Returns results with the most recent data including an inflight LWT (uncommitted). Commits an inflight LWT as part of the read.Writes NOT supported.
Same as SERIAL, but confined to the datacenter. Writes NOT supported.
requires net.jpountz.lz4:lz4 in the classpath.
requires org.xerial.snappy:snappy-java in the classpath.
All
Quorum in each datacenter.
Quorum of all nodes across all datacenters. Some level of failure is possible.
Quorum of replicas in the same datacenter as the coordinator node. Avoids communication latency between datacenters.
Closest replica as determined by the snitch. Satisfies the needs of most users because the consistency requirements are not stringent.
Closest two replicas as determined by the snitch.
Closest three replicas as determined by the snitch.
Returns a response from the closest replica in the local datacenter. For security and quality, use in an offline datacenter to prevent automatic connection to online nodes in other datacenters.
Closest replica, as determined by the snitch. If all replica nodes are down, write succeeds after a hinted handoff. Provides low latency and guarantees that writes never fail.
The number and rate of bytes sent for the entire session (exposed as a Meter).
The number and rate of bytes received for the entire session (exposed as a Meter).
The number of nodes to which the driver has at least one active connection (exposed as a Gauge<Integer>).
The throughput and latency percentiles of CQL requests (exposed as a Timer).
The number of CQL requests that timed out
The size of the driver-side cache of CQL prepared statements.
How long requests are being throttled (exposed as a Timer).
The size of the throttling queue (exposed as a Gauge<Integer>).
The number of times a request was rejected with a RequestThrottlingException (exposed as Counter).
The number of connections open to this node for regular requests (exposed as a Gauge<Integer>).
The number of stream ids available on the connections to this node (exposed as a Gauge<Integer>).
The number of requests currently executing on the connections to this node (exposed as a Gauge<Integer>).
The number of -orphaned- stream ids on the connections to this node (exposed as a Gauge<Integer>).
The number and rate of bytes sent to this node (exposed as a Meter).
The number and rate of bytes received from this node (exposed as a Meter).
The throughput and latency percentiles of individual CQL messages sent to this node as part of an overall request (exposed as a Timer).
The number of times the driver failed to send a request to this node (exposed as a Countner)
The number of times a request was aborted before the driver even received a response from this node (exposed as a Counter).
The number of times this node replied with a WRITE_TIMEOUT error (exposed as a Counter).
The number of times this node replied with a READ_TIMEOUT error (exposed as a Counter).
The number of times this node replied with an UNAVAILABLE error (exposed as a Counter).
The number of times this node replied with an error that doesn't fall under other 'errors.*' metrics (exposed as a Counter).
The total number of errors on this node that caused the RetryPolicy to trigger a retry
The number of errors on this node that caused the RetryPolicy to trigger a retry, broken down by error type (exposed as Counters).
The number of errors on this node that caused the RetryPolicy to trigger a retry, broken down by error type (exposed as Counters).
The number of errors on this node that caused the RetryPolicy to trigger a retry, broken down by error type (exposed as Counters).
The number of errors on this node that caused the RetryPolicy to trigger a retry, broken down by error type (exposed as Counters).
The number of errors on this node that caused the RetryPolicy to trigger a retry, broken down by error type (exposed as Counters).
The total number of errors on this node that were ignored by the RetryPolicy (exposed as a Counter)
The number of errors on this node that were ignored by the RetryPolicy, broken down by error type (exposed as Counters).
The number of errors on this node that were ignored by the RetryPolicy, broken down by error type (exposed as Counters).
The number of errors on this node that were ignored by the RetryPolicy, broken down by error type (exposed as Counters).
The number of errors on this node that were ignored by the RetryPolicy, broken down by error type (exposed as Counters).
The number of errors on this node that were ignored by the RetryPolicy, broken down by error type (exposed as Counters).
The number of speculative executions triggered by a slow response from this node (exposed as a Counter).
The number of errors encountered while trying to establish a connection to this node (exposed as a Counter).
The number of authentication errors encountered while trying to establish a connection to this node (exposed as a Counter).
